image.altText: A man adjusts his tie as he looks at a journalist who sits opposite him

props.synopsis: At this time last year, David Speirs was adamant his position as SA Liberal leader was "100 per cent secure". But the past 12 months have brought almost nothing other than challenges for the now 40-year-old, who last week stood in the dock.

title.children: David Speirs has gone from '100 per cent secure' to a guilty plea

image.altText: Spray paint marks on a two-lane road next to a barrier in the middle and cars parked on the side

props.synopsis: A 65-year-old Adelaide man who was hit by two cars in Adelaide's CBD on Sunday night has died, with the driver of one of the vehicles being charged.

title.children: Driver charged after man struck by two cars in fatal crash

image.altText: A blue lake, with a green cliff and a rural city stretching on behind the cliff.

props.synopsis: More than 18,000 people are expected to move to SA's Limestone Coast in the next 25 years, but local leaders say a mountain of work needs to be done.Â

title.children: Mount Gambier is tipped to boom, but leaders say infrastructure is lacking

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: Two young brothers who were reported missing from Adelaide more than a fortnight ago and were last seen in Canberra has been found safe and well, police say.

title.children: Adelaide young boys found interstate after missing for 17 days

image.altText: A portrait of Rob Halliday looking sombre, standing in front of a rocky shore.

props.synopsis: The level of violence faced by school leaders is the worst it's ever been, with both students and their parents reportedly making threats, according to a long-running survey of more than 2,000 principals.

title.children: 'Bitten' by students, 'cyberbullied' by parents: School leaders report record violence

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: As SA's domestic violence royal commissioner Natasha Stott Despoja prepares her final report, a postcard from an 11-year-old child may well be on her mind. Â

title.children: Seven words at the heart of SA's domestic violence royal commission

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446962

props.synopsis: After hitting the winning runs to end a 29-year drought, Jason Sangha says South Australia saved his cricket career.

title.children: 'They have saved my career': Jubilation spills over as SA celebrates Shield win

image.altText: Two women holding a large picture of a young child surrounded by fallen leaves

props.synopsis: Grandmother Mariya Samkova has made a new home in an Australian country town, but dreams of returning one day to Ukraine to see her relatives and friends.

title.children: Ukrainian woman who became a refugee in her 70s builds new Aussie life

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines flight comes into land at Adelaide Airport.

props.synopsis: In South Australia, only two marginal seats are regarded as up for grabs at this election, so the campaign jets might not be descending with anything like the same frequency as they will elsewhere, writes Kathryn Bermingham.

title.children: Two SA seats will be hotly contested in the federal election

image.altText: Cathy Freeman beams at her 2000 medal ceremony. Bruce McAvaney smiles with greying hair

props.synopsis: Following this week's unveiling of the Brisbane 2032 Olympics plan, we took a dive into the archives to relive, in the words of Bruce McAvaney, one of Australia's most memorable sporting moments.Â

title.children: Freeman's 'incredible' 400m victory retold by the man who called the race

image.altText: An excavator and three people in a field.

props.synopsis: A private search for clues relating to the presumed abduction and murder of Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordon, who disappeared from Adelaide Oval in 1973, begins in South Australia's Mid North.

title.children: Search underway 52 years after girls disappeared from Adelaide Oval

image.altText: Two smiling women stand either side of a man with a big red beard holding an infant.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill steps up for the family of a boy born with a rare and debilitating genetic condition. But none will go further than Mitch McKenny, who is ready to run 27 marathons in 27 days to raise awareness and funds for research into the syndrome.

title.children: Tiny Huxley needs a hero. He's found one in marathon man Mitch

image.altText: A mob of kangaroos in a dry paddock with some lying down

props.synopsis: An expert has called for the marsupials' deaths to be investigated after previous occurrences were dismissed as being caused by a grass that can cause "staggers' in kangaroos. WARNING: This story contains content that readers may find distressing.

title.children: Kangaroos found dead, paralysed near SA beach affected by algal bloom

image.altText: Composite of Opposition Leader and Peter Dutton and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in high-vis.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton are on the move. Where they go tells us what â and who â they care about.

title.children: Here's where Albanese and Dutton are likely to go during the election

image.altText: Two people in white forensic outfits covering their entire body observing the inside of a home. One is taking a photo inside.

props.synopsis: Police officers found a 47-year-old woman, a 16-year-old girl, a 13-year-old girl and a 10-year-old boy with stab wounds at the scene in Baulkham Hills after being contacted by the children's father.

title.children: Woman accused of stabbing her three children in their bedrooms

image.altText: The sunset can be seen over a scene of destruction with workers searching for survivors

props.synopsis: In Myanmar, there are reports of screaming coming from piles of rubble as the window to find earthquake survivors is quickly diminishing.Â

title.children: Window for Myanmar quake rescues closing as Russian and Chinese teams arrive

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: The US president has issued an unusually critical assessment of Vladimir Putin, saying he was angered when the Russian president criticised Volodymyr Zelenskyy's leadership.

title.children: Trump says he's 'pissed off' with Putin, threatens oil tariffs on Russia

image.altText: Eight Race Around the World contestants posing for a group shot, blue background.

props.synopsis: The untold stories from behind the scenes of Race Around the World, the show that launched John Safran and became one of the 90s most unlikely hits.

title.children: 'We could have died': Inside the insanity of an unlikely 90s TV hit

image.altText: An ariel from helicopter of building under water.

props.synopsis: Graziers say more aviation fuel is desperately needed as helicopters play a key role in evacuations, supply drops, and mustering.

title.children: Homes evacuated, livelihoods washed away by floods in outback Queensland

image.altText: A woman sitting at a round dining table holds a photo of her late adult brother.

props.synopsis: Australia's corporate watchdog calls on superannuation funds to overhaul the way they deal with death insurance claims, noting excessive delays, poor customer service and ineffective claims handling.

title.children: ASIC's scathing review of super funds finds 'genuine suffering'

image.altText: A slow shutter speed blurs the movement of two horses training at a racetrack.

props.synopsis: Workers in the racing industry across Australia say horses are being routinely drugged for track work at the peril of rider and horse safety in a malpractice which could breach nation-wide racing rules.

title.children: Routine drugging of race horses 'disaster waiting to happen'

image.altText: Protesters gather in front of the US consulate during a demonstration in Nuuk

props.synopsis: The Greenland prime minister says "President Trump says that the United States is getting Greenland. Let me be clear: The United States won't get that."

title.children: Trump says US will 'get Greenland', new prime minister says it won't

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Wall Street tumbled 2 per cent on Friday taking global markets with it. The ASX 200 has followed suit falling 1.3 per cent in early trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX tumbles after Wall Street retreats on stagflation fears

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Private health funds slammed for 'price gouging'

image.altText: A man with red hair and a red beard wearing a suit and a woman with black plaited hair and dark skin holding her chin in hand

props.synopsis: Prince Harry faces explosive bullying allegations as he walks away from the charity he founded in his motherâs name.

title.children: 'Number one risk': Sentebale chair strikes back against Prince Harry

image.altText: Brian Mier, dressed in short-sleeved shirt, examines a large lump on his arm.

props.synopsis: Victoria's planned surgery waitlist has been growing again, with warnings many are still languishing in a "hidden" queue in the state's complex health system.

title.children: As Victoria's surgery waitlist grows, so do concerns over a 'hidden' queue

image.altText: The logos of the four big banks in Australia

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) is due to meet for the second time in 2025 this week. Many people paying off a mortgage are hoping for a cut, but they may be waiting a while.Â

title.children: When is the next RBA meeting? Will we be getting another interest rate cut?

image.altText: man with faded red bucket hat, navy tshirt holds steering wheel inside tractor cabin with 4 young boys, 2 seated on each side

props.synopsis: In Australia the Crown owns all resources under the ground, regardless of who owns the property. Therefore the Byrne family face a lengthy and costly legal battle with limited prospects of success.

title.children: Fifth-generation farming family determined to protect their land from miners

image.altText: Min Woo Lee holds the Houston Open trophy.

props.synopsis: After leading by a stroke heading into the final hole, Australia's Min Woo Lee breaks through for his first PGA Tour victory following a tense finish at the Houston Open.Â

title.children: Lee holds nerve to claim Houston Open title for first PGA Tour win

image.altText: German startup Isar Aerospace explodes after falling down in Norway

props.synopsis: German startup Isar Aerospace says this was an initial test as part of a project aimed at kickstarting satellite launches from Europe.

title.children: Space rocket explodes seconds after take-off but described as a 'success'

image.altText: Four police officers wearing dark blue behind police tape.

props.synopsis: Police are searching for a man who allegedly stabbed a father and shot his son at a Surfers Paradise unit complex.

title.children: Manhunt underway after son shot, father stabbed on the Gold Coast

image.altText: Malaike Mfalme and Max Pick stand beside each other with an arm around each other, smiling.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers have developed a world-first scale to measure an almost universal experience for trans adolescents and adults â gender euphoria â that could have significant implications for mental health.Â

title.children: Researchers take a more positive approach to trans identity

image.altText: Pat Cummins and Usman Khawaja appeal to the umpire, with their arms outstretched

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia confirms its line-up of international matches for the 2025/26 season, avoiding a repeat of last year's disjointed scheduling for its Test players.

title.children: CA gives Test stars clear gap before next summer's Ashes series

image.altText: Mitchell Starc celebrates an IPL wicket for Delhi Capitals.

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc stars with the ball for Delhi Capitals in their seven-wicket victory over a Sunrisers Hyderabad team captained by Pat Cummins in the Indian Premier League.

title.children: Starc takes five-wicket haul in IPL showdown with Cummins and Head

image.altText: A doctor slumped over looking defeated.

props.synopsis: A remote Queensland GP says he is quitting for the sake of his mental health as he struggles to find someone to take over.

title.children: GP's desperate plea to keep outback town's only clinic open
